p: In recent years, the use of plant essential oils and their bioactive compounds as potentially effective biopesticides gained much importance. Essential oils are now a recognized alternative to hazardous artificial pesticides in the agricultural industry [ 38, 39, 40]. These substances possess a number of advantagesâ€”efficacy, high biodegradability, low toxicity, various modes of action, and availability of source materials. However, the use of essential oils in plant protection has some limitations, mostly due to high volatility and low solubility [ 41].
